result.execSummary:
The defendant Maltremus D Jackson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 9/15/15; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 9/15/15; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Huber privileges pursuant. to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and family care. Credit for 3 days time served.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maltremus D Jackson III

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/22/14. AR

Defendant Maltremus D Jackson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work and family care.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 9/15/2015; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 9/15/2015; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Character Letters received and filed with court.

Defendant Maltremus D Jackson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Counts 2 and 3 DISMISSED and READ IN.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 9/15/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Maltremus D Jackson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense advised the court that this case will be resolved with a change of plea. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 8/27/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Maltremus D Jackson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB

Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions, Defendant's Witness List, State's Requested Jury Instructions and State's Witness List. sab
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Hearing on motions proceeds.  Arguments by counsel.   Court finds there is probable cause for the search warrant.  Court denies defense motion as to the fruits of the search.  Court finds there is no requirement to disclose the confidential informant to the Court or to anyone else.  Court denies motion to disclose.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maltremus D Jackson in court with attorney Eugene E Detert.  Randy Sitzberger for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:James Henner-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/11/14.

14RM018879  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-04-2014

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Maltremus D Jackson in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Maltremus D Jackson in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
